answers.answer: Weigh you, take your blood pressure, have you pee in a cup. They might take blood samples to check you for anything bad like HIV... pap smear, possibly, and swab to test for any bad bacteria.They'll ask questions about your family history, like history of diabetes, heart problems, ect. They may even schedule an ultrasound because of how far along you are.

At my 22 week appointment,  all they did was check my weight,  blood pressure, listen to babys heartbeat and measure my belly. My doctor and I talked about the upcoming glucose test and he gave me the drink that I'll need to take 4 weeks later. I look at it every day and dread it lol. If this isn't your first appointment,  not much happens.  Same old, same old.

question: Hey I just turned 23w1d I have a doctors appointment tmmrw and was wondering what all will they do at this appointment?
title: doctor question
